newsitem.title: FRANCE: Air Liquide in two German glass projects.
newsitem.headline: Air Liquide in two German glass projects.

text.p: Chemicals firm Air Liquide said it had signed agreements with two German glassmakers to supply oxygen and oxycombustion technology for glass-melting furnaces.

It did not disclose terms but said it had reached an accord with Gerresheimer Glas to supply around 100 tons of oxygen daily and an agreement with Glasfabrik Lamberts to provide oxycombustion technology for its new Wunsiedel plant.
"The glass industry is one of the growth markets for the Air Liquide group," it said in a statement.

"Air Liquide brings its on-site and oxycombustion technology. The all oxygen firing technology allows the best thermal efficiency, the lowest investment, and at the same time, the lowest emissions of nitrous oxides for the glass melting process," it said.
